newsitem.title: JAPAN: NCB asks Sakura Bank to buy new shares -- Sakura.
newsitem.headline: NCB asks Sakura Bank to buy new shares -- Sakura.

text.p: Nippon Credit Bank Ltd has asked Sakura Bank Ltd to buy new shares it plans to issue, Sakura Bank president Shunsaku Hashimoto told a news conference on Tuesday.
Hashimoto, who is also chairman of the Federation of Bankers' Associations of Japan, said NCB had asked Sakura to reply to the request by early May.
"We would like to consider whether we will accept the request after scrutinising NCB's restructuring programme and balance sheet," he said.
He said Sakura would also take into account the overall stability of Japan's financial system when making its decision.
Hashimoto said NCB had asked other banks which are major NCB shareholders and which issue bank debentures to buy shares from the new issue.
NCB announced a plan earlier this month to increase its capital by 290.7 billion yen by issuing news shares.
